title: Dan Goggin (rugby union)
text:
Dan Goggin (born 10 December 1994) is an <a href="Irish%20people">Irish</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player for <a href="United%20Rugby%20Championship">United Rugby Championship</a> and <a href="European%20Rugby%20Champions%20Cup">European Rugby Champions Cup</a> side <a href="Munster%20Rugby">Munster</a>. He plays primarily as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Centre">centre</a>, though he can also play as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Wing">winger</a>, and represents <a href="Young%20Munster">Young Munster</a> in the <a href="All-Ireland%20League%20%28rugby%20union%29">All-Ireland League</a>.
Early life.
Goggin was born <a href="Limerick">Limerick</a> and first played rugby at the age of 5 for <a href="UL%20Bohemians%20R.F.C.">UL Bohemians</a>. He attended <a href="St%20Munchin%27s%20College">St Munchin's College</a> and represented the school for three years in the <a href="Munster%20Schools%20Rugby%20Senior%20Cup">Munster Schools Rugby Senior Cup</a> before joining <a href="Young%20Munster">Young Munster</a>.
Munster.
Goggin made his competitive debut for Munster on 3 September 2016 when he started against <a href="Scarlets">Scarlets</a> in the sides opening <a href="2016%E2%80%9317%20Pro12">2016–17 Pro12</a> fixture. Goggin came on as a replacement for <a href="Jaco%20Taute">Jaco Taute</a> in Munster's famous 27–14 win against <a href="M%C4%81ori%20All%20Blacks">Māori All Blacks</a> in <a href="Thomond%20Park">Thomond Park</a> on 11 November 2016. Goggin was nominated by his teammates for the 2017 John McCarthy Award for Academy Player of the Year, alongside <a href="Conor%20Oliver">Conor Oliver</a> and <a href="Brian%20Scott%20%28rugby%20union%29">Brian Scott</a>. On 1 June 2017, it was announced that Goggin had been promoted to the senior Munster squad ahead of the 2017–18 season.
In Munster's opening <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Pro14">2017–18 Pro14</a> fixture against <a href="Benetton%20Rugby">Benetton</a> on 1 September 2017, in which Goggin was used as a replacement, he suffered a knee injury which subsequently ruled him out for 4 months. Goggin made his return from the injury on 19 January 2018, coming off the bench for <a href="Munster%20Rugby%23Munster%20A">Munster A</a> in their 27–0 <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20British%20and%20Irish%20Cup">British and Irish Cup</a> win against <a href="Ospreys%20%28rugby%20union%29">Ospreys Premiership Select</a>. He signed a new two-year contract with Munster in February 2018.
Goggin scored his first try for Munster in their 39–22 away win against <a href="Southern%20Kings">Southern Kings</a> on 7 April 2018. He scored two tries in Munster's 64–7 win against <a href="Ulster%20Rugby">Ulster</a> in round 5 of the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Pro14">2018–19 Pro14</a> on 29 September 2018. Goggin made his <a href="European%20Rugby%20Champions%20Cup">Champions Cup</a> debut on 13 October 2018, starting in Munster's opening <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20European%20Rugby%20Champions%20Cup%20pool%20stage%23Pool%202">2018–19 pool 2</a> fixture against English side <a href="Exeter%20Chiefs">Exeter Chiefs</a>, which ended in a 10–10 draw in <a href="Sandy%20Park">Sandy Park</a>. He scored two tries in Munster's 31–24 away win against <a href="Connacht%20Rugby">Connacht</a> on 5 January 2019. For his performances throughout the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Munster%20Rugby%20season">2018–19 season</a>, Goggin was presented with the Munster "Young Player of the Year" award in late April 2019.
Goggin won his 50th cap for Munster during their 15–6 defeat against <a href="Saracens%20F.C.">Saracens</a> during round 4 of the <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20European%20Rugby%20Champions%20Cup%20pool%20stage%23Pool%204">2019–20 Champions Cup</a> on 14 December 2019. He made his first senior start on the <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Wing">wing</a> for Munster in their 13–6 defeat against provincial rivals <a href="Leinster%20Rugby">Leinster</a> in round 9 of the <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20Pro14">2019–20 Pro14</a> on 28 December 2019. Goggin signed a two-year contract extension with Munster in January 2020. A hand injury sustained in Munster's <a href="2020%E2%80%9321%20Pro14">2020–21 Pro14</a> win against <a href="Benetton%20Rugby">Benetton</a> on 30 January 2021 required surgery, ruling Goggin out for 7–8 weeks. He signed a two-year contract extension with Munster in January 2022.
International.
Goggin played for the <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20sevens%20team">Ireland national rugby sevens team</a> in 2015 and 2016. He was part of the Ireland squad that attempted to qualify for the 2016 Olympics, but lost to Spain in the quarter-finals and failed to qualify.
